retail.class_customer module

class retail.class_customer.Customer(customer_id, country, transactions)[source]

Bases: object

Methods

avg_transaction_amount()

Calculate the average transaction amount for the customer.

avg_transaction_amounts_plot(dataset)

Calculate average transaction amount for each customer and plot it using a box plot.

categorize_spending()

Categorize customers based on total transaction amount.

country_distribution_plot(dataset)

Visualize geographical sales distribution.

customer_segmentation_plot(dataset)

Visualize customer segmentation based on purchase history and quantity.

total_spent()

Calculate the total amount spent by the customer.

total_transactions()

Calculate the total number of transactions made by the customer.
avg_transaction_amount()[source]

Calculate the average transaction amount for the customer.

Returns: - float: The average transaction amount for the customer.

avg_transaction_amounts_plot(dataset)[source]

Calculate average transaction amount for each customer and plot it using a box plot.

Parameters: - dataset (pandas DataFrame): DataFrame containing transaction records for all customers.

categorize_spending()[source]

Categorize customers based on total transaction amount.

Returns: - str: Spending category of the customer ('Low Spender', 'Medium Spender', 'High Spender', or 'Unknown').

country_distribution_plot(dataset)[source]

Visualize geographical sales distribution.

Parameters: - dataset (pandas DataFrame): DataFrame containing transaction records for all customers.

customer_segmentation_plot(dataset)[source]

Visualize customer segmentation based on purchase history and quantity.

Parameters: - dataset (pandas DataFrame): DataFrame containing transaction records for all customers.

total_spent()[source]

Calculate the total amount spent by the customer.

Returns: - str: The total amount spent by the customer formatted as dollars.

total_transactions()[source]

Calculate the total number of transactions made by the customer.

Returns: - int: Total number of transactions made by the customer.

data_preprocessed(data)[source]

preprocess data

Parameters:
data_filestr

name of locally saved data file.

Returns:
df_joinedpolars.DataFrame

Preprocessed data set with 84 observations and 6 variables (subject, gender, scenario, attitude, frequency, mean_pitch).

summariespolars.DataFrame

Mean pitch value grouped by attitude (informel, polite) and gender (female, male).

find_match(s)[source]
Searches for specific patterns in a string. Here used to find descriptions

that contain information about broken products.

Parameters:
sstr

Input string to search for patterns.

Returns:
bool

True if any of the specified patterns are found in the string, False otherwise.

Checks if a word is a stop word.

Parameters:
wordstr

The string to check.

swlist, optional

List of stop words. Default is the variable sw.

Returns:
str or None

The input word if it is a stop word, otherwise None.

get_summary(data)[source]

Generate a summary of the dataset including various statistics.

Parameters:
datapolars.DataFrame

Input polars.DataFrame containing the dataset.

Returns:
None

Prints the summary of the dataset including the following statistics: - Number of unique invoice codes - Number of unique stock codes - Average number of stock codes per invoice - Average quantity per stock code - Number of unique customer IDs - Country with the most stock codes

most_frequent(descriptions)[source]

Finds the most frequent element in a list of descriptions.

Parameters:
descriptionsList[str]

List of descriptions.

Returns:
str or None

The most frequent description in the list. If the list is empty, returns None.

plot_map(data)[source]

Plot a map with countries colored based on the number of invoices.

Parameters:
datapolars.DataFrame

Input polars.DataFrame containing the dataset with country-wise invoice information.

Returns:
None

Displays a map with countries colored based on the number of invoices

quantity_boxplot(data)[source]

Generates a box plot showing the distribution of quantity of items bought for each product.

Parameters:
dataDataFrame

Input DataFrame containing the quantity of items bought for each product.

Returns:
None

Displays the box plot with the quantity of items.

read_data(data_file)[source]

Reads data from a CSV file into a Polars DataFrame.

Parameters:
data_filestr

The name of the CSV file containing the data.

Returns:
datapolars.DataFrame

A Polars DataFrame containing the data read from the CSV file.

Removes extra spaces from a string.

arrstr

Input string containing extra spaces.

Returns:
str

String with extra spaces removed.

Replaces stop words with None.

Parameters:
wordstr

The string to check.

swlist, optional

List of stop words. Default is the variable sw.

Returns:
str or None

None if the input word is a stop word, otherwise the input word.

Returns:
None

Set current working directory to desired local path

Parameters:

local path that should be used as current working directory.

Returns:
current_working_directorystr

Prints current working directory.
